I have purchased various leggings. For sizing reference, I wear a size medium/large in most clothing because I'm muscular. I typically purchase a size 6 in Wunder Under Luon fabric, but I'd have to go to a size 4 for the Luxtreme. I also wear a size 4 for the aligns - so the stretchiness definitely plays a role in choosing which size is right for you.
The only fabric I like is Luon, which is unfortunate for me because Luxtreme seems to be the favorite child. I recently purchased the HR Wunder Under in Slate Blue - and I'm slightly disappointed with the color. This seems to be a trend with the Lululemon advertisement photos -- being inconsistent with what the vibrancy is outside of professional lighting. The photos show a pastel blue, and the pant arrived as a dusty blue. It is what it is. Moreover, the fabric has changed once again. I am a huge fan of how grand my butt looks in these workout leggings, but I keep returning for the pair that I bought 2 years ago, not because I want to try all sorts of blends. Almighty Lulu-Gods, why do you keep changing the blends of your cotton fabric without any sort of disclaimer? This legging felt twice as stretchy as a 25" pant than the HR WU 28" I purchased in Royal Blue years ago. One is cotton and thick, this one is more polyester than cotton and really thin.
All complaints aside, I refuse to wear any other legging besides Lululemon until I can find one that makes the butt look as good as this does. I also do not have to adjust my leggings constantly. They remain up for the most part. But, I have a tiny waist and a large butt, so there's already some issue there. I have to say though... as obsessed as I am with this brand. Mass production has lead this company the ability to rake in the millions by over-pricing yoga clothes that probably take $10 to make.

Weird.
Side note: not sure if it's just the color I got (vintage grape) or the material itself but these show sweat big time! Not a huge deal to me, I don't have a problem with it, but I am surprised these are marketed as a "training" legging when they show sweat so easily.

column6: I guess I should have taken the time to check out the reviews before I bought these pants. Like others, I loved them at first. Super soft, stylish and perfect for the gym. Unfortunately after wearing them a handful of times (maybe 8-10) they wore a nickel-sized hole in the knee. I brought them back to to the store where I bought them, confident in Lululemon's excellent customer service and commitment to standing behind the quality of their product. At first it seemed like I would be taken care of- they took the pants, said they would send them to be repaired, and even agreed to ship them back to my house so I didn't have to make another trip to pick them up. So far so good! When the package came about a week or so later, my pants were nicely packaged in the familiar red Lululemon bag. But when I got them out, I saw that the "repair" job was totally inadequate. They just sewed the pants together at the hole, so now there is a seam at one knee (but not the other). Looks totally awkward and not something anyone would wear out in public. Lululemon, please bring back the fabric quality we have all come to know and love!
